programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find an antique barber's chair, two lawnmowers and a voodoo chest, and try selling the items on at an auction in Louisiana.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen start a bidding war at an auction in Washington, DC, where they set out to sell a Civil War-era revolver and some South African gold coins.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary and Moe compete with a huge crowd of bidders, and the locker they are after is guaranteed to make Moe's wife angry.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Take a Deep Breath, It's Lesa
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Conroe, where they come face to face with an old adversary.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to Ohio to inspect the house of an auctioneer, before travelling to Indiana, where Frank falls in love with a Happy Days-inspired pinball machine.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: After the battle of Acre, we join the Knights Templar in Paris where Landry, a veteran of the Holy Wars, fears that the Order has lost its way. When the blood of a brother is shed, Landry and the Templars are forced to take up their swords again..

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Pope Boniface arrives in Paris to learn of the grail's whereabouts and make Landry Master of the Temple. However, the pope's unexpected arrival threatens de Nogaret's plans to marry King Philip and Queen Joan's daughter, Princess Isabella, to Prince Edward of England. Later, Landry and Parsifal seek vengeance on Roland, the highwaymen's leader, who killed Godfrey and Marie, Parsifal's fiancee, after the farmer came to the Templar master's aid. Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney star.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys buy a valuable 1961 guitar, and discover a copy of National Geographic covering the first moon landing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a ring that once belonged to notorious 1930s gangster Lucky Luciano and a letter signed by a famous American football coach.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman catches her boyfriend trying to sell her ring, and Les gets his hands on some valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is tempted to break one of the shop's most important rules when a fast-talking client catches him off-guard.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating whether spiritual leaders known as shamans, who have healed and protected people throughout history really have contact with extraterrestrial realms.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether alien encounters influenced the establishing acts of the Founding Fathers as he travels to Washington, DC.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor's bidding war with Ricky and Bubba continues at Fort Worth, where he seeks an ally. Meanwhile, other buyers find they might be better off working alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures, and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley discovers a potential robber hiding in the fridge, but Les ignores her cries to increase security - which is a decision he may regret come nightfall.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finds himself unable to stop spending, and is under pressure to make sales before being branded a hoarder.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are tempted by a musket owned by famous inventor Eli Whitney and a golf ball that once belonged to president Lyndon B Johnson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys uncover a Miami Dolphins souvenir from the team's very beginnings, and meet a customer who claims to have unseen footage of President Franklin D Roosevelt.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a vintage military motorcycle and replica cannon in Arlington, Virginia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a rare punt gun after winning two units at an auction in Pasadena.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The big money buyers find themselves out of their comfort zones in DeSoto, and a new face from across the pond threatens to ruin Ricky and Bubba's day.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas hoping to land a locker of a lifetime, and Mary flouts the law in her eagerness to score a dream unit.

programme.title: Air Emergency
programme.desc: See just what it’s like to be involved in emergency landings around the world. Plus, leading aviation experts explain how pilots are able to safely land aircraft on land or water… and just what happens when they get it wrong..

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos heads to Peru to investigate whether the strange symbols covering its desert floor are key to proving aliens once visited Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the possibility that insects have descended from, and could have links to, extraterrestrials which landed on Earth thousands of years ago.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car in a unit auction in Covina, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a whack-a-mole arcade game and a water cannon, after fighting it out at a Brooklyn storage auction.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A record-breaking cyclone wrecks South Pacific islands, a cruise ship becomes stranded in a storm, and two friends get caught in a deadly avalanche.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at the events that led to the catastrophic blow-out that tore through Aloha Airlines Flight 243 en route to Hawaii.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Desiree Burch, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Glenn Moore. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They have to fill an egg cup with tears, remember an Aussie rules football team and play Taskmaster squash.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and broadcaster Joan Bakewell joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew members need urgent replacement engine parts, which can only be obtained if Lister marries the hideous daughter of an alien tribal chief. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Montreal, Canada where replicas of a DeLorean and the Ghostbusters' Ecto-1 are among the vehicles taking part in the downhill race.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank face their fears in this series showcasing the most memorable finds by the duo.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori and Brandon win one of two aviation storage units that have come up for sale, while biker Dan bags the other.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a cave-diving team into the largest unexplored cave network on Earth. Below the jungles of Mexico, they push further and deeper than anyone has gone before.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson test-drives two estate cars - the BMW M5 and Mercedes E63. Richard Hammond tries out motor-home racing, while James May pits an Alfa Romeo 159 against a man who crosses the Humber estuary without using its famous bridge. The Stig puts Honda's Civic Type R through its paces and former England rugby union forward Lawrence Dallaglio is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Auckland, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets more tasks for comedians including Frank Skinner. He takes a boulder onto a train for a pleasant excursion. Then he, Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan and Josh Widdicombe try to make a Swedish man blush.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees The Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins, Strictly Come Dancing judge Bruno Tonioli and TV host Steve Jones compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include catalogues, flat-pack furniture and gym etiquette.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Janey Godley and barrister Robert Rinder joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Jo Brand, John Sessions, Dara O Briain and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the topic of jumble, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew lands on a prison planet where crime is prevented by a 'Justice Field', but Rimmer finds himself convicted by his own feelings of guilt of 1,169 murders - the crew of Red Dwarf, who died after he failed to replace a drive plate properly. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and Rimmer put their lives in danger while trying to boost Holly's IQ, as she has her lifespan dramatically reduced and they find themselves trapped on a powerless Red Dwarf. Starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Hattie Hayridge, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Lucy remembers the time she was in an episode of Doctors acting alongside Fleabag star Phoebe Waller Bridge. Jon's never seen the footage. Until now.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Ruxton, a physician who lived a quiet, respectable life in Lancaster, until in 1935 he beat, strangled and stabbed his wife and housemaid to death.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The decade of propaganda, impassioned speeches, newspaper articles, posters and campaigning that all led to one moment - Hitler being made Chancellor of Germany in January 1933.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. On the way, Miranda Krestovnikoff visits the only beach race in Europe run under Jockey Club rules at Laytown Races and Alice Roberts finds herself sent to the Irish salt mines. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Shipwreck Psycho
programme.desc: Forensic scientists search an island off Western Australia where a Dutch ship was wrecked in 1629 - only for one of the survivors to turn on the others, leading to mass murder.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the UFO famously sighted at Roswell may have been an experimental aircraft developed by the Nazis during the Second World War. Plus, theories about Glenn Miller's disappearance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: The Day They Dropped the Bomb
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Featuring a minute-by-minute account of what happened on that tragic day, through archive footage and interviews with eyewitnesses who rarely speak about their experience of the bombing. Also interviewed is navigator Theodore Van Kirk, who was the last surviving member of the crew who dropped the bomb, before his death in 2014.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A Sudanese politician vows to go on hunger strike until the UK returns the skull of an important 19th-century ruler to his country. While searching for the article, Boyd is asked to re-open the case of an Iraqi shopkeeper murdered in front of his daughter 20 years ago. A tip-off from a Foreign Office official gives the team a lead - and as it probes further, it seems the two investigations could be connected. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian finds the library card of cold case victim Dr Richard Symes, leading the team to reinvestigate the death of the professor, who perished after falling from the roof of his college three years' previously. Sandra and Gerry interview Symes' widow, who believes principal Jeremy Ventham drove her husband to suicide following a conflict over teaching methods. Crime drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A massive explosion rips through the Woolwich ferry, and Blue Watch is forced to join forces with Hallam and the Fire Boat crew to tackle the ensuing blaze. Meanwhile, the situation between Kevin and Sally comes to breaking point.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A Second World War bomb is discovered, which puts the wives at risk. Meanwhile, the clock begins to tick for Cate's unborn child.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads are bemused after they are ordered to capture a dangerous escaped panther, and wonder if they are the victims of a hoax. Meanwhile, Evans is disturbed to learn a friend may be bullying an Asian soldier.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Frank's life insurance company asks for his medical records, and Tricia is afraid Mark will find out her secret. Despite her best efforts to cover things up, she is ultimately forced to confess that Chrissie is not his daughter. Jac returns to the hospital and Ric advises Diane that she should take some time off to deal with her personal problems - though she's adamant that it isn't necessary.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. When the boat accident victim arrives, the department becomes contaminated with radioactive material, forcing Charlie to close A&E. Trapped inside, Chloe has to reveal she's pregnant to ensure her unborn child's safety, while a suspected murderer waits anxiously as the military police close in.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. On a less harrowing note, he also enjoys a romantic encounter with new Drugs Referral Officer Rochelle Barratt. Meanwhile, Honey finally confronts Scott, who breaks down and admits to killing his previous wife Karen. Understandably shocked by his confession, she implores him to turn himself in - but when the police arrive at their house, neither husband nor wife is anywhere to be seen.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is sent to prison as Grant is released. Rose comes back into Pete's life. Mandy finds Aidan in a difficult mood. Sanjay persuades his friends to play the horses.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete needs to take urgent action to have a future with Rose, so enlists Frank's help. Sharon awaits the outcome of the meeting between Grant and Phil.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin is faced with the consequences of his affair with Sally after a party on the houseboat. Meanwhile, Nick's fears for Ariadne escalate, but he is temporarily distracted when he has to rescue a boy from a well.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A mistake by Duncan leads to the Glenbogle campsite being booked up by a group of naturists and Kilwillie reveals a secret. Meanwhile, Golly is prompted to take drastic action when Carlin the wolf escapes, and his hopes of a relationship with Irene are dashed when he sees her and Duncan in a passionate embrace.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Chris is bowled over by new nurse Beth and wastes little time trying to woo her, while Anna is annoyed that the whole village appears to know about her pregnancy, except the one person who really matters. Henry nurses a broken heart and confronts his love rival after one too many in the pub, and David's taxi-driving job takes its toll _ resulting in a horrific accident. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie has managed to get away with Derek for a weekend in the Cotswolds, leaving Aveline in charge of the cooking.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Yvonne refuses to come out of her room when partner Barry leaves the Maplins holiday camp, but soon changes her mind after Gladys organises a stand-in for her. Comedy, starring Ruth Madoc and Diane Holland.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Middle-aged romantics Jean and Lionel finally decide to move in together, but fall out over incidental details - such as whose house they are going to live in. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Blamire try to encourage Compo to adopt a more spiritual outlook on life. Peter Sallis, Michael Bates and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Crabtree and John are transporting a convicted axe murderer to prison when she escapes to exact revenge on those who testified against her.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a body is found in a freezer, Lucien looks into the man's sexuality for clues into his death, and whether or not this was an accident or murder.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After being released from jail, notorious paedophile John Davies admits to the abduction and murder of a child 25 years previously. Suspicious of his motives, the detectives reopen the unsolved case in an unusual attempt to prove his innocence, reinvestigating the boy's disappearance while on a demonstration with his left-wing activist parents. Crime drama, guest starring Adrian Schiller and Samantha Bond.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Two long-dead sexually conjoined bodies fall through the ceiling of a former bank after being disturbed by builders, and a gold ingot found at the scene suggests a connection with another cold case. When Eve links one of the corpses to the Opus Dei organisation, Boyd is warned off pursuing that particular line of investigation.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Andrew is pushed to the edge and as he runs out of options, he concocts a plan to take drastic measures. But first, he will need help. In the present day, a vital piece of evidence comes to light and Laura seeks to discover its origin. Now in a desperate position, she must use all her wits to get the information she needs, but with Katy and Liam's assistance, she is led to a startling new suspect. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Zoe Tapper, Richie Campbell and Katherine Kelly.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne and James are at loggerheads following the revelations at the Brockenhursts' party. With Oliver fixated on discovering the origins of his father's new protege, Susan uses the opportunity to plan a covert trip to meet with a new friend, and enlists her maid Speer to keep the true nature of the rendezvous under wraps. Meanwhile, Lady Templemore begins work on her lavish plans for her daughter's wedding, but much to her disappointment, Lady Maria seems fixated on someone other than her fiance.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Trump and the Virus: America in Crisis - Tonight
programme.desc: How seriously could the coronavirus pandemic damage President's Trump's chances of re-election later this year? As the United States grapples with a full-blown health crisis, ITV's Washington Correspondent Robert Moore asks whether his controversial leadership style has properly addressed or even exacerbated the challenge ahead.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Lewis is in court to claim for the outstanding amount owed for two snakes that he sold to his friend, while David hopes to receive 1,000 pounds for the cost of belongings he says his housemate destroyed.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five team-mates from Peterborough Amputee Football Club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Tom, Geoff, Bim and Alex work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Billy and Cain are stunned to discover that Will has stolen the 4x4 they were holding against Malone, and Cain makes it clear that Will has now signed his own death warrant. Al and Priya kiss again, but Jai interrupts, while Wendy encourages Bob to come up with his own idea for getting Luke and Victoria back together.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen confronts Geoff with the contents of his emails, Gemma tries to be positive as Aled's hearing aid is fitted and David apologises for using Alina.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jenny's death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The former tabloid editor interviews Alan Sugar about his career and personal life. The Apprentice star discusses his financial and legal troubles, and the nervous breakdown he experienced while fighting a libel case. He also looks back on his teenage years, his controversial tenure as chairman of Tottenham Hotspur, and the untold story behind his company's satellite dishes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Friends and family from Manchester answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How does a helicopter loop the loop? Plus, learn how a 200,000 square metre ball park in the hottest city in the US is cooled?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on repairing a 1973 Chevrolet Camaro, and hope they will be able to make a profit on the time, energy and funds they put into restoring it.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With the end of the season fast approaching, the rookies risk cave-ins at their abandoned mine claim. Deep underground, Bomb King George is trapped in the blast zone.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Chaos breaks out at the OCC garage, and the programme catches up with each of the Teutuls since they went their separate ways.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike braves gators in the Florida to snatch a party boy's Cessna Float plane. Later, Kevin enrols a vengeful divorcee for a high-altitude, high-risk heist in Colorado.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe tries to withstand the harsh cold weather of the Soo Locks in winter and help out with their annual clean.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into how automatic sliding doors are manufactures, and the distilling process that goes into the production of gin.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The development process behind the production and manufacture of scuba lights and convertible sandals.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to blow the world's finest crystal, make the slimmest TVs, heat the deepest swimming pool, and fill a million bottles a day of the world's favourite ketchup.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The rookies on board the Kodiak begin to discover how difficult crabbing is, and Sig battles his brother as well as the seas.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The self-proclaimed 'best dredger in Nome' quits the fleet, and Shawn takes his daughter to work - but he soon has his hands full with a hydraulic leak.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With the end of the season fast approaching, the rookies risk cave-ins at their abandoned mine claim. Deep underground, Bomb King George is trapped in the blast zone.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads for Turin to buy a Fiat 500, but the only way to get it back to the UK is to drive it, and the engine is in need of urgent attention.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a well-known customer trade his 1931 Cadillac for a Model A and the car restorer is impressed by an exceptional collection of classics.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini enjoys his Austin Cooper twin-engine Mini at Monterey and sells his 2001 MV Augusta F4 and 1967 275 GTB/4 Ferrari alloy body car at auction.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: Fishing boats sink frequently in the Bering Sea, but normally at least some of the crew survive. In 2001, Seattle-based Arctic Rose, went down, claiming the lives of all 15 crew members. Some human remains were recovered 14 years later..

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Phil and Sig's experiment in trading their junior deckhands comes to a close in the third week of hunting king crab.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Rough conditions on the Bering Sea take their toll, and while Shawn makes the most of his excavator skills, one diver realises he does not have enough money to continue dredging.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Margate, Kent, Drew Pritchard snaps up a good deal at a 'junk emporium' run by some of his best contacts. At a Georgian mansion in Fife, he finds a surprising bargain.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Col's crew takes one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on repairing a 1973 Chevrolet Camaro, and hope they will be able to make a profit on the time, energy and funds they put into restoring it.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire, that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Darrell Miklos attempts to decode and follow a ''treasure map' created by his boyhood idol, former Nasa astronaut Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper.

programme.title: Sharks and the City: New York
programme.desc: Biologist Craig O'Connell finds out whether the return of seals to the New York City harbour could also turn around the area's declining great white sharks numbers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A method for preventing buildings collapsing during an earthquake, the measures taken to ensure electricity is in constant supply, and how balloons are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to blow the world's finest crystal, make the slimmest TVs, heat the deepest swimming pool, and fill a million bottles a day of the world's favourite ketchup.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part two of two. The veteran broadcaster meets more inmates inside two of Indiana's most dangerous women's prisons. Among them are Dawn Hopkins, who was sentenced to life for murdering her three-month-old son, and Sarah 'Cindy' White, who was incarcerated as a teenager and will spend the rest of her life behind bars. The journalist also hears the remarkable story of Linda Darby who, after escaping from jail in 1972, spent the next 35 years on the run - before the law finally caught up with her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, with tiny but unmistakable clues that pointed to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular DJ was found murdered in a local garden, police raced to find answers. With no other leads, detectives turned to a blood spatter expert.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A 2009 case in which 27-year-old Jessika Kalaher was found strangled in her car in Texas. With her wallet and car keys missing, detectives turned to security cameras for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two college students were gunned down while parked in a quiet lovers' lane. Residents of the tiny community of Juliette, Georgia, were beside themselves with panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigator Barbara Christiansen rescues a horse found lying in a pool of water after heavy rain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is visited by Mr Wilson the shar-pei puppy, Martha the alligator, Cheeky the bird and Polar the samoyed - a snow coloured Siberian dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carli arrives at the salon with an entourage in tow, while Jessica brings her baby, mother, aunt and two friends to attend her wedding dress fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: There's A Shark In The Salon!
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at one of the world's most prestigious bridal salons.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa is tasked with saving a five-year-old's paralysed dachshund, while Dr Chris is presented with a list by another little girl.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Animal welfare officers working for the Michigan Humane Society recall cases in which animals made amazing recoveries.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Agents Henry Ruiz and Kristi Adams investigate a call about an injured puppy with a deep wound on its neck.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic examiners can expose a killer's deadly intentions when murder victims are lured to their deaths by acquaintances.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of physical therapist Holly Cantrell, a mother-of-three who vanished in January 2017 in McAlester, Oklahoma. It transpired that Holly harboured a web of secrets that may have led to her disappearance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When popular college student Martin Roberts went missing, only a cryptic note was left behind. Two years later, his relatives were intent on solving the mystery once and for all.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientific and forensic techniques can help solve puzzling crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular DJ was found murdered in a local garden, police raced to find answers. With no other leads, detectives turned to a blood spatter expert.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Summer falls in love with a dress nearly twice her budget. Brooke, an NFL cheerleader, fights to show off her pom-poms - despite her mother's opinion. Elsewhere, bride Meredith must decide which shoes will be most comfortable for her, having recently had back surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Mallory wants to go outside her comfort zone, disagreeing with her entourage, while Lorie looks for a dress for her vow renewal after 25 years of marriage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kate is engaged for the fifth time and clearly has trouble making decisions, while Jackie wants a dress for a ceremony at which she and her husband will be renewing their vows.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cindy and Lamar's four children from other relationships are excited about picking a dress, while Cheyna wants to look like a princess on her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: LeighAnn eyes a figure flattering gown, but her father cannot stand to see his little girl looking all grown up. The staff set out to find a dress that pleases both.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Taylor shares her appointment with her recently separated parents, who reject each other's wedding dress selections.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey, including an old sewing machine, a broken drawing table and a collection of cutlery. Arthur Smith narrates.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A man hopes to raise money from a classic car collection to avoid losing his mansion, but it's another of his possessions that catches the attention of Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou. A young drummer brings in a silver elephant given to him by his grandparents, planning to cash in and set up a recording studio, while a single mum parts with a five-carat diamond ring to give her sons a holiday. A client gets rid of some family heirlooms, including a sherry glass thought to have belonged to Queen Victoria, to fund a long-awaited trip to see her birth mother in Australia.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A grieving mother has gastric bypass surgery to reduce her weight, but now has to confront the emotional issues that cause her to overeat.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: When a college freshman vanished, concerned friends and family called in the police. A student was questioned over the matter, revealing a deadly tale of jealousy and revenge.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: How policeman Walt Chavis found himself up against his own brother, forced to choose between his duty and his family.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: When Patrick Gilhuley was shot dead by his partner Virginia Vertetis in 2014, she claimed it was an act of self-defence. However, her ex-husbands provided evidence of her violent past leading to a 30-year prison sentence being issued.
